intro: Stenochilus subfloccosus, commonly known as the woolly stenochilus, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, fuzzy leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
